column2: Americanist Pilgrimage
Go on an patriotic pilgrimage to the great Americanist holy cities: Boston, New York, Philadelphia, Washington, and Richmond.

The time has come for you to undertake an epic pilgrimage to the five great Americanist holy cities: Boston, New York, Philadelphia, Washington, and Richmond. \n\nBut first, you must prepare for the journey.
Pilgrimage Preparation
On second thought, now is a bad time to travel.
I need nothing beyond the clothes on my back.
I shall travel in a splendid carriage.
I will bring a retinue of bodyguards for protection.

In times gone by, Boston was known as a center of learning for its many universities and libraries. Some of the ancient tomes from these libraries have found their way into the private collections of patriotic Americanists. If you seek knowledge, surely Founder Adams and Founder Hancock will look favorably upon you as you visit the holy sites of the Hub.\n\nThe natives you see along the road are sporting their traditional red stockings.
Pilgrimage to Boston

The sprawling ruins of old New York explain why the ancients simply referred to it as The City. Even now you can feel the enormous power and wealth of the seat of the empire as you approach Manhattan, heart of the sleepless city. With the guidance of Founder Hamilton and Founder Jay, perhaps you can do your part for American prosperity.\n\nFrom the bank of the Hudson River, you see numerous merchant ships and barges of all sizes.
Pilgrimage to New York

As a child you learned that Philadelphia was the birthplace of America, where the founders met in brotherly love to form a great union of previously disparate states. You hope that the holy sites of Philadelphia will inspire you to emulate Founder Franklin and Founder Paine, whose words had the power to sway others in thought and deed.\n\nAlong the road, you see peddlers selling traditional pretzelled bread from their carts.
Pilgrimage to Philadelphia

Named and built in honor of Founder Washington and Founder Lincoln, several of the holy monuments of the capital of Columbia still stand as a testament to America's enduring glory. Even during the dark years when Washington is under the control of heathens, patriotic Americanists work diligently to preserve and protect the many sacred relics of the founders.\n\nDespite the patriots' best efforts, major portions of the old city have been reclaimed by swamps.
Pilgrimage to Washington

The river city is known for its history of patriotic military struggle, and today serves as a trade center for the rich agricultural lands of the south. You hope to stir within yourself the keen insight and courage of Founder Jefferson, Founder Madison, and Founder Henry.\n\nSoldiers from the region are known to demand either liberty or death if captured.
Pilgrimage to Richmond
Approach the city...
The holy city is already part of your demesne, so it is a simple matter to visit the sacred sites you know so well.
Relax at the familiar holy sites of your city.
Donate to the order that maintains the holy sites.
The holy city is ruled by [From.GetTitledFirstName], and even though you are part of the same realm it is customary for a noble to request [From.GetPossPronoun] permission to enter the city.

The holy city is ruled by [From.GetTitledFirstName], a foreign lord. Though [From.GetSubjectPronoun] shares your faith, it would be wise to be respectful as you request permission to visit [From.GetPossPronoun] city.
The holy city is ruled by [From.GetTitledFirstName], an infidel of the [From.Religion.GetName] faith. It may be difficult to get [From.GetPossPronoun] permission to continue your pilgrimage.
Make a formal request for access to the city.
Flatter the ruler of the city with honeyed words.
Request entrance in the name of the Founders.
Give an inspiring patriotic speech.
Present a gift of gold and jewels.
Slip a few coins into the right palms.
Forcefully demand that you be allowed to enter.
Enter the city in secret.
Carefully enter the city in secret.
You slip by the guards\n
You are noticed by the guards\n
The holy city is ruled by [From.GetTitledFirstName]. [From.GetSubjectPronounCap] has previously granted you permission to visit the holy cities in [From.GetPossPronoun] demesne.
Inform the gatekeepers that I have arrived.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has requested your permission to travel through your demesne on [From.GetPossPronoun] [From.Religion.GetName] pilgrimage.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has come to your demesne on [From.GetPossPronoun] [From.Religion.GetName] pilgrimage, praising your wisdom and requesting access to your city.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] is requesting access to a holy city in your demesne as part of [From.GetPossPronoun] [From.Religion.GetName] pilgrimage. [From.GetSubjectPronounCap] gives compelling patriotic reasons for you to accept.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has come to your demesne on [From.GetPossPronoun] [From.Religion.GetName] pilgrimage. As [From.GetSubjectPronoun] requests access to the city, [From.GetSubjectPronoun] speaks with such sincerity and passion it nearly brings a tear to your eye. It would surely be madness to turn away such an inspiring pilgrim!
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has given you a gift of gold and jewels in exchange for permission to proceed on [From.GetPossPronoun] [From.Religion.GetName] pilgrimage through your demesne.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] seems to think the power of [From.GetPossPronoun] realm entitles [From.GetObjectPronoun] to make a pilgrimage to the [From.Religion.GetName] holy sites within your demesne.
Your agents have discovered [From.GetTitledFirstName] secretly visiting [From.Religion.GetName] holy sites in your demesne, without your permission! What should be done with [From.GetObjectPronoun]?
Personally act as host for [From.GetObjectPronoun].
Allow [From.GetObjectPronoun] entry.
Deny [From.GetObjectPronoun] entry.
Throw [From.GetObjectPronoun] in the dungeon!
Kill that insolent fool!
Allowed Pilgrimage
Denied Pilgrimage

[From.GetTitledFirstName] graciously invites you into the city. [From.GetSubjectPronounCap] hosts you in [From.GetPossPronoun] own great hall, and provides an honor guard to accompany you to the holy sites.
I had a wonderful time with my new friend.
My faith has been strengthened, and I must spread it.
Bring me the dice and wine, I'll tell war stories!
Perhaps the faith of my host can be swayed.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has been informed of your presence in the city, and [From.GetSubjectPronoun] grants you permission to enter the city and visit any of the holy sites.
There is always more to learn from the Founders.
A group of guardsmen stop you. Your presence seems to have offended [From.GetTitledFirstName], and [From.GetSubjectPronoun] has decided not to let you visit the holy sites of the city.
This isn't over.
I am [This.GetTitle], I go where I please.
Several members of the local garrison attempt to drag you to the dungeons! Surely [From.GetTitledFirstName] is to blame.
Your vassals will view this as tyrannical.\n\n
I'll go quietly.
You'll never take me alive!
You escape to plot revenge\n\n
I always have a plan.
Men-at-arms block your path with blades drawn.\n\n"In the name of [From.GetTitledFirstName], we'll take your head now..."
Not without a fight!
Defend me, men!
You make your way secretly past the city walls, and visit the important holy sites. You see a few other fellow pilgrims, and try not to draw attention to yourself.
Secret patriotism is the purest form.
I should talk to my fellow pilgrims.
I will acquire a sacred relic to take with me.
[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] of Boston has violated sacred law by refusing me entrance during my pilgrimage. By ancient rights, I may now claim the city if I choose.
[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] of New York has violated sacred law by refusing me entrance during my pilgrimage. By ancient rights, I may now claim the city if I choose.
[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] of Philadelphia has violated sacred law by refusing me entrance during my pilgrimage. By ancient rights, I may now claim the city if I choose.
[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] of Washington has violated sacred law by refusing me entrance during my pilgrimage. By ancient rights, I may now claim the city if I choose.
[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] of Richmond has violated sacred law by refusing me entrance during my pilgrimage. By ancient rights, I may now claim the city if I choose.
The city will be mine!
I must swallow my pride.
You had a great time with [From.GetTitledFirstName], and are proud to call [From.GetObjectPronoun] your friend.
Good.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] becomes your friend\n\n
You and [From.GetTitledFirstName] are at each others' throats, and [From.GetSubjectPronoun] is now your rival.
I will crush [From.GetObjectPronoun].
[From.GetTitledFirstName] becomes your rival\n\n
You were unable to complete the difficult journey of the pilgrimage. Perhaps someday you can attempt the pilgrimage again, and wash away the stain of failure.
Failed Pilgrimage
I have shamed my dynasty.
You return home from your pilgrimage, weary from the road but wiser for the journey. The friends you have made and the experience you have gained will surely aid you in the coming years.
Successful Pilgrimage
A still more glorious dawn awaits!
Successful Pilgrimages
Hurricane!

Messengers report that a massive hurricane has made landfall several days ago near [From.County.GetName], devastating much of the nearby coastline! It will be months before everything is back to normal.
My lands are unaffected.
Hurricane!
A hurricane has struck your county of $PROVINCE$!
Characters in this county must fend for themselves\n\n
Characters in this county are well protected\n\n
Hurricane Damage
High winds and flooding have damaged many buildings in this county.
Flooded Farmland
Floods have wiped out much of the harvest for this year.
Ruined Roads
Roads and bridges in this county have been badly damaged by a recent storm.
Damaged Trade Post
The merchant docks and warehouses have been damaged and looted.
Protector in the Storm
You responded well when a hurricane struck, and kept everyone safe.
Opportunist
You were noticed taking advantage of a disaster.
I think I can keep everybody safe.
Keep the roads clear, protect those close to me.
Focus on aiding the common folk.
Have your men plunder under cover of the storm.
No need to worry, let the storm come!
The sky grows black over the ocean as a massive storm approaches. The wind blows at gale force. Torrential rains flood the streets and fields.\n\n[This.Location.GetName] is a dangerous place to be!
Hurricane strikes [This.Location.GetName]
I might not be up to the challenge.
I'll try to stay alive.
Fortunately I have the ability to protect myself.

The sky grows black over the ocean as a massive storm approaches. The wind blows at gale force. Torrential rains flood the streets and fields.\n\nFortunately, you are well protected in [This.Location.GetName].
I'll be fine.
Do my part to aid those in need.
May [This.Religion.GetRandomGodName] protect those out in the storm.
Prey on the unprepared.
After a disaster, there are often unscrupulous men who wish to take advantage of the chaos. With damage from the recent hurricane, bandits are beginning to appear in $PROVINCE$.
Nothing can be done.
Put a bounty on them.
Kill the leaders, put their heads on pikes.

Large groups of the common folk in [This.GetName] are worshipping within a ruin emblazoned with the trefoil icon of the Atomicist faith. Some claim that anyone who receives the Blessing of the Atom will be able to wield great power.
Atomicist Revival
A surge of popularity of the Atomicist faith is underway in this province.
They should be encouraged.
Investigate this heresy personally.
Send [Root.Holder.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] to investigate.
Let the peasants have their faith.
Your agents report that bands of Atomicists have been spotted in $PROVINCE$, attempting to spread their faith. Their zealotry appears to spring from the Atomicist Revival in [From.GetName].
Expel the infidels from my lands with military force.
Drive the infidels out, in the name of [Root.Holder.Religion.GetRandomGodName].
They make some good points.

At the Atomicist Revival in [Root.GetName] you bear witness to the true power of the old world. You can sense it even now... the warm, thrumming energy of the Mighty Atom. You feel the seductive desire to harness its power and wield the sizzling, searing tools of the gods themselves. The spirits of this world seek to contain it for themselves, but with study and persistence you can defeat them.\n\nPerhaps with the right words, the right rituals, the right propitiations...
Atomicist Revival!
I will claim the power!
If you are a vassal, your liege will react\n\n
I will not turn away from my faith!
I will nip this heresy in the bud!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] comes to you with zealous Atomicist fervor in [From.GetPossPronoun] eyes. [From.GetSubjectPronounCap] attempts to convert you, claiming that [From.Religion.GetRandomGodName] is simply a manifestation of [This.Religion.GetRandomGodName]'s power.
[From.GetSubjectPronounCap] made some good points.
I will not turn away from my faith!
I will convince [From.GetObjectPronoun] to return to the fold..
To the dungeons with you!
Glorious power awaits!

You have abandoned your old religious practices, and embraced the awesome potency of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]. Will this lead you to power and glory, or see you fall into ruin at the hands of hostile infidels?
[Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] be praised!

Your Atomicist zeal seems to have swayed the mind of your liege. [From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided it would be wise to abandon his old faith and join you in dedicating [From.GetPossPronoun] life to unshackling the atomic spirits of the old world.
Praise [This.Religion.GetRandomGod]!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has not taken kindly to your Atomicist conversion. [From.GetSubjectPronounCap] sees you as a misguided infidel, rather than as a prophet revealing the truth about [This.Religion.GetRandomGod].
This is bad...

[Root.Holder.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] has returned from the Atomicist Revival in [From.From.GetName]. [From.GetPossPronounCap] theological skill has allowed him to resist the allure of the Atom, and swiftly put an end to the heresy.
Good work.

[Root.Holder.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] has returned from the Atomicist Revival in [From.From.GetName], having resisted the seductive power of the Atom. Unfortunately, the Atomicist agitation will take some time to die down.
We did what we could.
You just had a [GetFromRelation], therefore it's up to you to decide whether to grant [From.GetObjectPronoun] the Blessing of the Atom.
The sacred tradition must continue.
I grant [From.GetFirstName] the blessing I never had.
[From.GetFirstName] will not suffer that foul ritual.
You just had a [GetFromRelation], therefore your spouse will decide whether to grant [From.GetObjectPronoun] the Blessing of the Atom.
Your [GetFromRelation] has decided to grant the Blessing of the Atom to your newborn child.
Your [GetFromRelation] has decided to deny your newborn child the Blessing of the Atom.
Blessing of the Atom

You are brought to the chamber of blessings. The priest removes the sacred totems of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] from a heavy metal reliquary. She touches each relic to the associated part of your body: forehead, sternum, palm, groin, and heel. \n\nThe metal is warm against your skin, and you feel a pleasant tingling sensation.

You are brought to the chamber of blessings. The priest removes the sacred totems of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] from a heavy metal reliquary. She touches each relic to the associated part of your body: forehead, sternum, palm, groin, and heel. \n\nThe metal is warm against your skin... in fact, it's searing hot. You feel nauseous and an unpleasant burning sensation creeps through your body.

Your [GetFromRelation] is brought to the chamber of blessings. The priest removes the sacred totems of [From.Religion.GetRandomGodName] from a heavy metal reliquary. She touches each relic to the associated part of the infant's body: forehead, sternum, palm, groin, and heel. \n\n[From.GetFirstName] gurgles happily. The ritual has gone well.
[Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] be praised!

Your [GetFromRelation] is brought to the chamber of blessings. The priest removes the sacred totems of [From.Religion.GetRandomGodName] from a heavy metal reliquary. She touches each relic to the associated part of the infant's body: forehead, sternum, palm, groin, and heel. \n\n[From.GetFirstName] begins to cry, and is screaming before the ritual is over. You see a red mark on [From.GetPossPronoun] skin, and can only hope the injury is minor.
[Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] has not been kind.
Blessing of the Atom
This character has received the Blessing of the Atom.
Cursed by the Atom
This character exhibited a strong negative reaction when receiving the Blessing of the Atom as a child.
Denied the Atom
This character was denied the Blessing of the Atom by their parents.
Firearmed
In possession of a functioning pre-calamity firearm.
Calculator
In possession of a functioning pre-calamity mechanical calculating device.
Timekeeper
In possession of a functioning pre-calamity clockwork timekeeper.
Typewriter
In possession of a functioning pre-calamity mechanical lettering device.
Far-Seer
In possession of a functioning pre-calamity portable telescope.
Bookman
In possession of several intact pre-calamity academic books.
Salvage Expedition
The techpriests need a constant supply of salvaged Old World technology to continue their studies, and a lucky salvager might find himself wielding a powerful tech prize.
Salvage Expedition

The people of the Old World left many amazing artifacts behind. Powerful weapons, tools that aid in all varieties of work, machinery our most brilliant Techpriests do not fully understand, and beautiful objects our finest artisans cannot replicate. Much of the Old World is gone, consumed by centuries of rust, but a few rare artifacts survive in workable condition...\n\nAcquiring such an artifact will not only bring me wealth and prestige, it is the sacred duty of all followers of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName].
Hmmm, where will I find good salvage?

You check the maps, and have located several potential expedition sites in the province of [From.GetName]. The people of [From.GetName] follow the [From.Religion.GetName] faith, and are culturally [From.Culture.GetName].\n\nProvinces populated by infidels are more likely to contain items of the Old World, since they do not have the traditions of salvage.
That will be my destination.
That province is unacceptable.
Before leaving on your Salvage Expedition to [From.GetName], it would be wise to make preparations.
Set out with your men.
Consult the Techpriests for good salvage locations.
Assemble a battle-hardened warband to accompany you.
Send envoys ahead to smooth your travels.
Unfriendly Locals

You arrive in [From.GetName], and many of the local residents are distrustful or outright hostile towards you and your men. You notice them watching you surreptitiously and talking amongst themselves, and have a difficult time finding a place to rest.
Ignore them.
We're well armed, they won't risk attacking us.
My envoys have arranged for safe passage.
Try to keep a low profile.

Rust Cultists from a nearby realm are attempting to salvage Old World artifacts from your lands in [Root.GetName]. Their presence seems to be drawing the ire of the local [Root.Religion.GetName] population, who are preparing for a confrontation with them.
Let the locals drive them away.
We must avoid bloodshed.

Mixed among the local residents in [From.GetName], you see the occasional soldier wearing the colors of [From.Holder.GetTitledFirstName]. Fortunately, the soldiers seem to be ensuring that order is maintained and the locals allow you to pass without conflict.
Hostile Locals

Your continued presence in [From.GetName] has drawn the ire of the local peasantry, and you are now confronted by a disorganized mob of angry villagers. They may not be well armed, and they're certainly not well trained...\n\n...but there are a lot of them.
We should turn back.
Your Salvage Expedition is over.
Your Salvage Expedition continues.
We can fight our way through!
They'll back down from a vulgar display of power!
Peasants like silver, right?
Driven from [From.From.GetName]
Hordes of angry local villagers have driven you from their lands, ending your Salvage Expedition. If it makes you feel better, tell yourself you left to avoid shedding THEIR blood.
Competing Salvager
During your expedition to [From.GetName], you encounter an agent of an unknown lord who shares your faith. He appears to be scouting new salvage sites for his master, in direct competition with you!
May the best salvager win!
Direct him to a promising site nearby.
Make him disappear.
Collapse!

You hoped the wooden reinforcement beams would be enough, but one of them slipped. The centuries have not been kind to the crumbling concrete and rusty iron, and the whole unstable mess is coming down around you!
Run for it!
I won't let debris stand in my way!
I planned for this risk.
Recent Salvage
This character has recently gone on a Salvage Expedition.
Preparing Expedition
This character is preparing to go on a Salvage Expedition.
Salvage in [From.GetName]
Your expedition has turned up very little valuable salvage. You have explored many ruined buildings, and everywhere you look you find the ruins picked clean.
Disappointing.
Someone has been here before me...
There is another site nearby we could check.

Your expedition has turned up a few items of useful salvage. In the ruined buildings and tunnels you have uncovered several artifacts of the Old World, though you have not yet found the kind of major prize you were hoping for.
At least I found something.
Hawk these trinkets, I know of another site.

Your men have discovered a large metal box beneath the ruins of a long-forgotten structure in [From.GetName]. The strongbox is corroded but still intact. Who knows what mysteries or treasures of the Old World are sealed within it?
I'll know soon, crack it open!
Have your tinker open it carefully.
Salvage

You have found scraps of Old World artifacts, but none of them are especially well preserved. There are objects that may have once been used for cooking or as craftsmen's tools, but it's hard to tell with the corrosion and decay of the centuries. They might be worth a few gold pieces to the right buyer.

Your men have discovered a cache of corroded coins from the Old World. Their coins were inexplicably made out of base metals rather than gold or silver, dramatically reducing their value as working currency. Still, they might be worth a few gold pieces.

You have discovered a long-hidden supply of Old World glassware. Unlike iron objects which have mostly been consumed by rust, many glass objects have survived. You need but wipe off the centuries and you'll have finely polished Old World artifacts that artisans today cannot replicate.

Amongst a wreck of disintegrated iron, you find a fabulously preserved piece of Old World machinery. Though stained with rust, the beautiful object itself does not seem to have rusted. It is about three feet across, irregularly shaped, with a half-dozen holes perfectly cut partway through it. It is constructed from a metal that is lighter than iron.\n\nThis will be a great addition to your great hall, or part of a shrine.

Your men take to the box with hammers, and succeed in ripping the door off after a few hours. Whether it was the rough handling of the box, the ravages of time and moisture, or simple bad luck, you find nothing of value within.
Treasures!

The safe door finally opens, and you can see the contents: a variety of Old World jewellery, glittering with gold, silver, and precious stones. The craftsmanship is finer and more intricate than what modern goldsmiths can produce.
Papers?

The safe door finally opens, and you can see the contents: several old folios bound with crumbling dark leather and stacks of identical green paper strips with the rune "20" in the corners. It's amazing how well the safe has preserved its contents, the seal must have been perfect. The folios are filled with line after line of numbers and symbols.\n\nYou would be rich, if paper currency were still in use.
Paintings?

The safe door finally opens, and you can see the contents: a collection of dozens of tiny paintings, discolored with age but extremely detailed. The paintings depict a family of people in the Old World. How these paintings were produced is a mystery to you, as the canvas is very thin and there are no visible brush strokes.\n\nThe cracked and crumbling condition of the paintings makes you think they are unlikely to last long after being removed from the sealed safe.

The safe door finally opens, and you can see the contents: a collection of small ornate boxes about the size of your palm. Each box contains a cylinder with patterns of tiny protrusions, adjacent to an array of metal tines of various lengths. You twist the small crank on the side of a box, it begins to plink out an Old World melody that probably hasn't been heard for centuries.\n\nThis will be a hit among my courtiers... a song for the ages!
Machinery!

The safe door finally opens, and you can see the contents: a complicated piece of Old World technology, the purpose of which is a mystery to you. The artifact features several prominent finely blown glass bubbles, mechanical innards, and thin flexible metal strands that shed greenish-black powder when disturbed.\n\nYou are unable to get the artifact to do anything. There seems to be something missing that you don't understand.
Firepower!

The safe door finally opens, and you can see the contents: a long metal tube with various bits of metal and brittle wood attached to it. You've heard stories that Old World knights used such devices to produce fire from nothing, but it's hard to believe you're seeing one for yourself. Though the safe has preserved it well, you will have to handle it gently and be unable to fix it if it breaks.

The safe door finally opens, and you can see the contents: a well preserved piece of Old World technology with the word "Underwood" written on it in gleaming gold-leaf letters. Rows of thumbnail-sized metal disks are attached to the complicated mechanical innards of the machine, each labelled with a unique rune.\n\nAside from its beauty as a piece of recovered tech, this machine would probably be very useful if you could figure out how to use and maintain it...

The safe door finally opens, and you can see the contents: a well preserved piece of Old World technology with the word "Arithmometer" engraved in the metal in a flowing script. The machine is dominated by a heavy horizontal metal cylinder, with numerals visible through gaps in the metal shell and a hefty metal hand-crank on the side.\n\nAside from its beauty as a piece of tech art, this machine would probably be very useful if you could figure out how to use and maintain it...

The safe door finally opens, and you can see the contents: a golden, palm-sized clamshell disk, attached to an intricate chain of gold. When you open the clamshell you see that one side is labelled with the numerals I through XII, and you realize that the artifact is an Old World timekeeping device.\n\nIt would be a stylish accessory for any lord, but it would be even more useful if you could understand its workings and restore its function.

The safe door finally opens, and you can see the contents: a segmented set of brass tubes with several curved internal mirrors and smoothly bulging disks of polished glass. The tools and knowledge to craft such a device have been lost, but you recognize it as an Old World version of today's spyglass.\n\nYou will be able to see things from a great distance.

The safe door finally opens, and you can see the contents: several stacks of thick books. They have been sealed away from the ravages of the weather, but the centuries have still taken their toll on their brittle brown pages.\n\nWith luck, a scholar fluent in Old World languages will be able to extract useful information from the books before they crumble into dust.
Salvage Expedition ends

Not all Salvage Expeditions end in success. Sometimes the recovered artifacts are badly damaged, sometimes they are worthless, sometimes there isn't anything to salvage because the area has been picked clean, and sometimes dangerous circumstances interrupt the expedition.\n\nThis is one of those times.
Until next time.

You have returned from your Salvage Expedition with baubles and artifacts of the Old World. Although you did not find a tech prize truly worthy of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]'s favor, at least you didn't return empty handed.
I'll keep the salvage for myself.
Someone will buy these trinkets.
I will donate these artifacts to the techpriests for study.

You have returned from your Salvage Expedition with an exciting tech prize, worthy of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]'s favor. Your court is buzzing with word of your success, and the techpriests are already coming to you with requests to examine your prize. It remains to be seen whether you can return the artifact to a functional state.\n\nThis will surely bring you fame, power, and understanding of the old world.
I must study and repair my prize.
The Past Restored

After weeks of study, your armorers have finally restored your Old World firearm to working condition! Much of the wood body had to be replaced, but the metal parts were functional. The charges required to operate the weapon are in extremely short supply, as many of those found alongside the weapon were dangerously unstable and your armorers do not yet know how to construct additional charges.\n\nYou will be a fearsome and inspiring figure on the battlefield!
This is my boomstick!

After weeks of study, your tinkers have finally restored your numeric calculating machine to working condition! You are still learning how to operate it: you enter numerals by sliding the levers into the correct positions, then turn the heavy crank and the machine produces the result of addition in mere seconds.\n\nThis will make it much easier to keep track of the rents and taxes that are owed to you!

After weeks of study, your tinkers have finally restored your gilded timekeeping device to working condition! Once the device is activated by inserting a key and twisting it, it begins to emit a soft ticking sound and the slender arms move smoothly across its face. You must handle the artifact carefully, because many of its small parts are irreplaceable.\n\nYou will be aided in any tasks that require precise measurement of time!

After weeks of study, your tinkers have finally restored your lettering machine to working condition! Their fingertips are black from handling powdered charcoal and other attempts at creating a useful ink. Study of the device has revealed much about the prowess of Old World smiths.\n\nYou are now able to issue decrees in the neat, authoritative letters of Underwood himself!

After weeks of study, your tinkers have finally restored your brass spyglass to working condition! Polishing with a soft cloth has brought the shine back to the metal, while the glass optics have retained their nearly perfect transparency. When you look through the eyepiece you are able to see things at a distance others could only dream about, even gazing at the Moon and stars as the people of the Old World must have.\n\nThe potential military advantages are enormous!

After weeks of study, your scholars have learned many things about your collection of pre-calamity books. Several of the books have have fallen to pieces during transport or study, but those that survived are providing valuable insight into medicine, engineering, and other topics.\n\nMore study will reveal additional secrets of the old world!
Unsolved Mysteries

Despite weeks of effort you have failed to restore your salvaged prize to a useful state. Your assistants don't possess the knowledge or the tools to help you accomplish this task, and your efforts only seem to be causing additional damage. Major portions of the prize are damaged or missing, and there may be some mystical component required to make the device function that is not available to you.
I can still display it as art.
Someone will buy it from me.
The real prize is the knowledge I've gained.
The techpriests will find a use for it.
Donated Tech Prizes
Tech Scavenger
This character is an accomplished scavenger of Old World technology.
Bequeathment
Your late [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] bequeathed an antique firearm to you. Hopefully it hasn't been damaged or lost in the confusion of [From.GetPossPronoun] passing.
Your late [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] bequeathed a pre-calamity antique typewriter to you. Hopefully it hasn't been damaged or lost in the confusion of [From.GetPossPronoun] passing.
Your late [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] bequeathed a pre-calamity mechanical calculator to you. Hopefully it hasn't been damaged or lost in the confusion of [From.GetPossPronoun] passing.
Your late [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] bequeathed a pre-calamity pocket watch to you. Hopefully it hasn't been damaged or lost in the confusion of [From.GetPossPronoun] passing.
Your late [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] bequeathed a pre-calamity brass telescope to you. Hopefully it hasn't been damaged or lost in the confusion of [From.GetPossPronoun] passing.

Your late [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] bequeathed a collection of pre-calamity textbooks to you. Hopefully they haven't been damaged or lost in the confusion of [From.GetPossPronoun] passing.
Grown-ups think you can't be trusted with it...
All these council meetings are confusing...
Now where did my [GetFromRelation] keep it?
I've been using it since I was young.
I've ensured I will retain possession of it.
The artifact is lost to the ages
Take Aim!

An arrow glances off your armor as the battle is joined, the air fills with a flurry of battle cries, and you hear the ringing sound of steel on steel.\n\nYour foes surge towards you, but you raise your Old World firearm to single out a looming warrior leading the charge. You pull the trigger and the warrior is felled with a deafening blast of light and smoke, his armor useless.
None dare to oppose the Firebringer!
Fools, I am the Thunderhand!
My marksmanship is perfect.
Run from me, cowards!
Storytelling

Sometimes you feel the urge to use your Old World typewriter to write things beyond the normal decrees, proclamations, and correspondence. Perhaps history will remember you more favorably if your thoughts on the events of the day are recorded in your own neatly machine-lettered words.
My dynasty will be remembered.
I'll tell a rousing story.
I will use it only for affairs of state.
Death and Taxes

It may be boring, but it is a crucial task for any [Root.GetTitle] to ensure that his expected tax revenue matches the rents paid by his vassals. Your Old World Arithmometer has made it much easier for you to do just that. You feel much more confident calculating the expected contents of your treasury, and can ensure that the numbers reported by your advisers are accurate.
This enhances my reputation for shrewdness.
I'm more machine than man!
Some of my vassals are short a few coins.
Precision in All Things

Since you acquired your Old World pocket watch, you feel like things have been running like... well, clockwork. You are able to bring precision and confidence to any issue you face. While others struggle with primitive sundials, you keep your stylish ticking companion with you at all times.
Plus, it goes with everything!
I make the carriages run on time.
Well, I am pretty great.
Watch the Skies

Sometimes you take your Old World telescope to a high tower late at night, and gaze through it at the sky. Some might consider it frivolous, but you find it relaxing to see the Moon and wandering stars in a way few have since the calamity.
I'll study the wandering stars, also known as planets.
My telescope should be reserved for scouting.
It's very calming.
Intense Study

You have been spending some time studying your collection of Old World books. You are not fully fluent in the language, but you have determined that one of the books is a manual of Old World treatments for human disease. Though some of the words are arcane and confusing, there are many useful anatomical diagrams and descriptions of healing techniques.
This will help me heal my wound.
This will help me cure my illness.
This will help me treat my sick children.
I have learned many things.
Reading is boring.
the Firebringer
the Thunderhand
the Marksman
the Shrewd
the Calculator
the Chronicler
the Poet
the Stylish
the Timekeeper
the Astronomer
the Far-Seer
the Healer
the Learned
Invest in Broker

Every year, you have the option to select the finest exemplar of Consumerism, invest him with the title of Broker, and send him into the world to amass wealth on your behalf. Brokers are known for their skill with intrigue and diplomacy, and are castrated at a young age to ensure purity in their focus on the deal.
Recent Investment
Recently invested in a Broker and sent him into the world.
Recently Arrived
This Broker recently arrived in court.
Decadent Luxury
Consumerist merchants are providing a supply of luxury goods.
Consumerist Loan
Has taken a significant loan from the Consumerists.
Poor Credit
A reputation for not repaying debts.
Retired Broker
This character returned home with satchels full of gold.
Brokers Returned
Well Protected
Protected by carefully selected bodyguards.
Precious Heirloom
You made it clear your dynastic heirlooms are not for sale.
Broker arrives

A mysterious traveller has arrived at your court, requesting permission to reside there for a while. His name is [From.GetTitledFirstName], and he claims to be a wandering merchant of the Consumerist faith. He trades in luxuries and specializes in acquiring rare and unique artifacts.\n\nAfter all, who doesn't need a bit more luxury in their life?
Let him stay.
We have no need of him.
He should pay a toll for trespassing...
You will become an enemy of Consumerism\n
Grant Privileges

[From.GetTitledFirstName] claims that there is gold to be earned if you allow him special privileges in the markets of your demesne. More fine textiles, furs, spices, glassware, and Old World goods will find their way into your great hall, and the rising tide of [From.Religion.GetRandomGodName] will lift all boats.\n\nOn the other hand, your vassals might be annoyed by an outsider getting special access.
I want the finer things.
I do not need such things.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has noticed that your coffers are empty, and is offering to arrange a loan for you.
Yes, I need the gold.
Usury is a sin.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] informs you that you could repay your loan now, if you choose. Alternatively, you could pay a small fee to service the loan for a while.
Remove him from my court.
I can only spare a bit of gold right now.
Here is your money in full.
I'll repay him with my firearm.
I'll repay him with my lettering machine.
I'll repay him with my Arithmometer.
I'll repay him with my pocket watch.
I'll repay him with my telescope.
I'll repay him with my collection of books.
Old Loans

Consumerist envoys arrive at your court, asking if you thought they had forgotten about a debt owed to one of their Brokers. It seems the amount you owe has risen a bit with time, and they would like it repaid immediately.
Very well, here is your gold.
Guards! Remove them from my sight.
[From.GetTitledFirstName], an infidel Consumerist merchant, has been allowed to reside within the court of your liege. You have already had several theological disputes with him.
I will complain about him to my liege.
There's nothing I can do.

[Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] comes to you, complaining that the Consumerist infidel [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] has no place in your court. [From.GetTitledFirstName] requests that you compel the infidel to leave.
He is useful to me.
He must find a new host.
An Impious Proposal

[From.GetTitledFirstName] speaks to you privately:\n\n"I was glad you chose to allow me to remain in your court, despite my dispute with your spiritual advisor. I think you will find that there are many advantages to following the path of [From.Religion.GetRandomGodName]. For a small fee, I can reveal to you the secrets to prosperity."
I will not turn from my faith.
I think we have a deal.
An Enticing Offer

[From.GetTitledFirstName] comes to you as you hold court.\n\n"My liege, I see that you are in possession of an Old World firearm. I will arrange for you to be paid a significant sum of gold for it, with which you could fund an army. Once the sale is complete, I will leave your court."
I accept your offer.
I will negotiate a better price.
This is a precious dynastic heirloom.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] comes to you as you hold court.\n\n"My liege, I see that you are in possession of an Old World lettering machine. I will arrange for you to be paid a significant sum of gold for it, with which you could fund an army. Once the sale is complete, I will leave your court."

[From.GetTitledFirstName] comes to you as you hold court.\n\n"My liege, I see that you are in possession of an Old World mechanical calculator. I will arrange for you to be paid a significant sum of gold for it, with which you could fund an army. Once the sale is complete, I will leave your court."

[From.GetTitledFirstName] comes to you as you hold court.\n\n"My liege, I see that you are in possession of an Old World pocket watch. I will arrange for you to be paid a significant sum of gold for it, with which you could fund an army. Once the sale is complete, I will leave your court."

[From.GetTitledFirstName] comes to you as you hold court.\n\n"My liege, I see that you are in possession of an Old World portable telescope. I will arrange for you to be paid a significant sum of gold for it, with which you could fund an army. Once the sale is complete, I will leave your court."

[From.GetTitledFirstName] comes to you as you hold court.\n\n"My liege, I see that you are in possession of a collection of Old World books. I will arrange for you to be paid a significant sum of gold for them, with which you could fund an army. Once the sale is complete, I will leave your court."
An Ancient Object

[From.GetTitledFirstName] comes to you as you hold court.\n\n"My liege, I have recently become aware of an Old World firearm available for you to purchase. As long as you wield it you will inspire your soldiers, terrify the enemy, and bring prestige to your dynasty. Once the sale is complete, I will leave your court."
Be silent, and take my gold!
I will negotiate a better price.
That is not a priority for me.
Very well. *Scheme to steal it*

[From.GetTitledFirstName] comes to you as you hold court.\n\n"My liege, I have recently become aware of an Old World lettering machine available for you to purchase. Anyone who reads the decrees you produce with it, with their crisp black letters, will know that you are wealthy and powerful. Once the sale is complete, I will leave your court."

[From.GetTitledFirstName] comes to you as you hold court.\n\n"My liege, I have recently become aware of an Old World mechanical calculator available for you to purchase. It will allow you to accurately tabulate the taxes and rents owed to you. Once the sale is complete, I will leave your court."

[From.GetTitledFirstName] comes to you as you hold court.\n\n"My liege, I have recently become aware of an Old World pocket watch available for you to purchase. Beyond its stylish appearance it will allow you to perfectly keep track of time, a major advantage in many situations. Once the sale is complete, I will leave your court."

[From.GetTitledFirstName] comes to you as you hold court.\n\n"My liege, I have recently become aware of an Old World far-seeing scope available for you to purchase. With it you will be able to observe enemy troop movements from far away, or gaze at the stars as our distant ancestors once did. Once the sale is complete, I will leave your court."

[From.GetTitledFirstName] comes to you as you hold court.\n\n"My liege, I have recently become aware of a collection of Old World books available for you to purchase. With a fluent scholar of Old American translating them, you will gain deep insight into medicine, engineering, and other topics. Once the sale is complete, I will leave your court."
Broker Returns
Your loyal Broker [From.GetTitledFirstName] has returned to your court with his satchels brimming with gold and silver. It is time for him to retire to a life of decadent luxury.
He has done well for our faith.
He may keep some of the spoils.
He has earned his rest.
A courier has arrived with tribute from [From.GetTitledFirstName], your loyal Broker. May [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] continue to bring him prosperity.
Conspiracy!

A number of people in your employ have been discovered carrying foreign coins. Guardsmen, stablehands, and servants all with coins bearing the sign of the Dollar. There may be a Consumerist conspiracy afoot.
My wits and loyal advisers will protect me.
I need more bodyguards.
Put the traitors to the question.
Assassin!

Your crimes have not been ignored.\n\nAn assassin wearing a dark green cowl steps from the shadows, accompanied by an unfamiliar acrid scent. Before your guards can stop him, his blade flashes towards you and you must defend yourself.
Die, assassin!
En garde!
Boom, headshot!
Guards!

An hour after a hearty meal of roast chicken, you begin to feel a bit queasy and light-headed. You can barely breathe, and you clutch at your throat. Poison!\n\nCould it be that your food taster was bribed by the vile Consumerists?
Get me my court doctor!
They're all out to get me!
Lasting Damage

It has been several days since the attempt on your life, and you are suffering from vivid nightmares, hallucinations, and fatigue. Perhaps it is some kind of slow acting poison, or the handiwork of [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName]. You find it difficult to concentrate, and your thoughts are becoming erratic.
This is not just madness!

Those close to you are being targeted by assassins. You have just received word that your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName] has been found dead, with the sign of the Dollar carved into [From.GetPossPronoun] forehead.
Curse them!

Those close to you are being targeted by a Consumerist assassin. You have just received word that your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName] has been injured during an attempt on [From.GetPossPronoun] life.
Terror Beast
Rumor has it a terrible beast roaming the wilderness, and people are afraid to leave their houses.
Panic is spreading in [Root.GetName] among the common folk. There are reports of eerie sounds in the wilderness and livestock disappearing. Peasants are blaming the Beast of [Root.GetName].

Panic is spreading in [Root.GetName] among the common folk. There are reports of eerie sounds in the wilderness and livestock disappearing. Peasants are blaming the Chupacabra, claiming that they have found their animals drained of blood.

Panic is spreading in [Root.GetName] among the common folk. There are reports of eerie floating lights in the wilderness and livestock disappearing. Peasants are fearful that a Loogaroo is loose in the region, preying on them as they sleep.

Panic is spreading in [Root.GetName] among the common folk. There are reports of eerie sounds in the wilderness and livestock disappearing. Peasants are blaming the mysterious Hodag, a terrible monster covered with spines.

Panic is spreading in [Root.GetName] among the common folk. There are reports of eerie sounds in the wilderness and livestock disappearing. Peasants are fearful that a reclusive, foul-smelling Skunk Ape is responsible.

Panic is spreading in [Root.GetName] among the common folk. There are reports of eerie sounds in the wilderness and livestock disappearing. Peasants are blaming the Mothman, a terrible flying beast with glowing red eyes.

Panic is spreading in [Root.GetName] among the common folk. There are reports of eerie sounds in the wilderness and livestock disappearing. Peasants are blaming the Jersey Devil, a monstrous flying beast with a distinctive and terrifying scream.

Panic is spreading in [Root.GetName] among the common folk. There are reports of eerie sounds in the wilderness and livestock disappearing. Peasants are fearful of a Wendigo hiding in the wilderness and eating human flesh.
Panic is spreading in [Root.GetName] among the common folk. There are reports of eerie sounds in the wilderness and livestock disappearing. Some peasants are fearful of a Sasquatch in the region.
Terror Beast

Villages elders in [From.GetName] are requesting your aid in dealing with the beast terrorizing the countryside. They claim the creature is an agent of [From.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] sent to destroy them. Some of the elders have brought evidence of the beast for you to examine, hoping to convince you the situation is dire.
They're just superstitious [From.Culture.GetName] peasants.
I have my suspicions about the truth...
This might not be the work of a beast...
I will hunt down the beast.
Rumors of the beast terrorizing [Root.GetName] seem to be subsiding. It seems you were right to be skeptical.
Superstitious nonsense.

The peasants in [Root.GetName] have taken matters into their own hands, attempting to hunt down the beast terrorizing the countryside themselves. They are angry that you have not fulfilled your duty to protect them.
Oh well.
You and your men search high and low, but don't find any evidence of the beast. It must have just been superstitious peasants after all.
How embarrassing.
Meddling Kids

Investigation of the beast terrorizing [FromFrom.GetName] have turned up some troublemaking children perpetrating a hoax. Several of the youngsters are apprentices of local craftsmen. You suspect that punishing them severely would anger your vassals, but you would appear weak if you let children make a fool of you and cause panic in your demesne.
Boys will be boys.
Throw them in the stocks.
Cut out their clever tongues.
Scheming Lord

You have discovered that the supposed beast terrorizing [FromFrom.GetName] was all part of a complicated plot to drive free peasants away from prime plots of fertile land. A minor local lord seems to be behind the scheme.
I'll put an end to this..
Not really my concern.
I might be willing to turn a blind eye...
The Shepherd's Plea

Your men question local farmers and artisans, and you eventually find your way to the cottage of a shepherd who claims his flock was attacked by the beast. He shows you the mangled body of his prized Golden Merino, and pleads for you to find the beast before it kills again.
Give the shepherd some coin, and hand me my spear.
I will hunt it down.
This seems too dangerous.
Following the directions of the local farmers, you track the beast to its lair. The leaves nearby are spattered with drops of blood. Bleached white bones and other detritus litter the ground.
Enter the lair.
Prepare an ambush.
This is not merely an animal. It's a man!
The Beast

With an unearthly bestial noise, a terrible creature lurches out at you from the shadows. It lunges towards you and your men with fearsome madness in its eyes!\n\nIt moves so quickly that you barely have time to react.
Kill the beast!

Your soldiers engage the beast in melee combat and it swiftly retreats into the forest, wounded. Hopefully the injuries it has sustained will prevent it from being a threat. You are victorious, though you do not have a trophy to bring home or use to definitively identify the beast.

After a swift and brutal fight, the beast lies motionless at your feet. It appears to be an especially large silvertip bear, perhaps driven mad by starvation or disease. Its head will make a fine trophy, and the peasants will be glad their livestock are safe.

After a swift and brutal fight, several beasts lie motionless at your feet. They appear to be a pack of large grey wolves, perhaps driven mad by starvation or disease. Their hides will surely make a set of fine cloaks, and the peasants will be glad their livestock are safe.

After a swift and brutal fight, the beast lies motionless at your feet. It appears to be an especially large catamount, perhaps driven mad by starvation or disease. Its head will surely make a fine trophy, and the peasants will be glad their livestock are safe.
A Terrible Mistake

After a swift and brutal fight, the beast lies motionless at your feet.\n\nBut... it's not a beast, it's a man. Looking at the hairy and deformed body you can see why ignorant peasants might have thought him a monster, but you could have known better.
Oops.
Though you are victorious, you feel a stinging pain and a warm, damp spot on your clothing spreading from it. You hope the wound doesn't get infected.
Ouch.
You can't forget the rush of adrenaline as you fought the mighty beast! Perhaps it is time to devote your life to testing yourself against the most ferocious creatures of the natural world.
I am a hunter!
Hunting isn't for me.
The Hermit

Looking at the objects surrounding the lair, you realize that the "beast" is actually just a man. When he emerges, your men stay their arms. The old hermit seems a bit unhinged, with a wild beard and a touch of madness or brilliance in his eyes. He talks to himself in an unsettling way, but he doesn't seem to be aggressive or violent.
He might be useful in my court.
Get rid of him.
The Deformed Man

Looking at the objects surrounding the lair, you realize the "beast" is actually just a man. When he emerges, your men stay their arms. He is huge and strong, with deformities that might explain the rumors of a monster. You see a spark of intelligence in his eyes, but also a great deal of sadness.
The Crone's Warning

As you investigate a farmer's claims of missing livestock, a blind old crone grabs your arm and speaks:\n\n"You are doomed, [Root.GetTitle]. As surely as the red comet returns to Aquarius, your fate is sealed if you pursue this foolish quest. Turn back, and perhaps my visions will not come to pass."
I should turn back.
Tell me about your visions.
Quiet yourself, woman!
The blind crone was right!
The Witch

Rather than a beast lair, you have come upon a young woman inhabiting a remote shack. Based on the carved bones scattered around the shack and hanging from trees, you suspect she holds fairly unorthodox religious views. She is pretty despite the mud and leaves in her hair, and interacting with her reveals that she is a bit unusual but skilled with herbs and other folk traditions.
She might be useful in my court.
Unorthodox views? She's a witch!
Some of your courtiers seem a bit irritated that you invited an uncouth lowborn to your court. He may be useful, but he's causing a bit of friction.
I know just what to say...
He stays, get used to it.
They're right, he has no place here.
Your church vassals are concerned that you have allowed a witch to join your court. Several of them have requested that you banish her or turn her over to them.
Present a compelling theological case.
My decision is final.
She has no place at my court.
Let the church decide her fate.
Harboring Witch
Your church vassals suspect that one of your courtiers is a witch.
I've assimilated the local culture.
Assimilate the local culture
Do nothing
